FSW.content: logo-phonocentrism is necessary and necessarily finite > history of the possibility of symbolism
Freud: dream-interpreters were versed in symbolic riddling, a ground of interpretation giving the strongest credit to their Art

PPHS.content: Hegel: sign vs. symbol “symbol has identity w/ what it mimics, sign is foreign”
symbols (triangle, lion fox) possess the Bedeutung they’re expressing
despite symbol’s identity, sign’s arbitrariness is closer to independence, freedom of spirt than external, natural symbol [Saussure concurs in footnotes]

sign is essence of symbol, the symbol past, both in turn relevé by living concept, language w/out language, language become thing itself, voice murmuring in greatest proximity to spirit, identity of the name, of Being

F.content: Freud: symbol always symbol of an earlier symbolized, and Torok and Abraham examine symbol’s operative genesis, as a hieroglyph, so it never becomes a “dead symbol,” a substance
Abraham: symbol to semantic might just be symbol to symbol; what we most seek is to place symbol back into dynamism of intersubjective functioning
cryptonomy: crack (la ligne de brisure) of a symbol, upright column of name (colonne érigée d’un nom), blank voice of a scruple [see p. xiii], always extends beyond the self
Wolf Man calls himself by unspeakable name Thing (tieret), gives himself no name > entire body of a proper name always shattered (morcelé) by the topoi, la Chose est un morceau de symbole

WM.content: Marx on gold serving as symbol of itself, and that “nothing can serve as symbol of itself”

P.content: Kant looking for a bridge from sensible to supersensible (an analogy), a symbol—that crosses/closes abyss
bridge (Brücke) not an analogy, concept/effect of analogy makes the bridge itself

analogy of abyss & bridge over abyss require 3rd term, that which heals the gap, a symbol, bridge is symbol, symbol bridge > abyss calls for analogy (active resource of Critique), mais l’analogie s’abîme sans fin dès lors qu’il faut bien un certain art pour décrire analogiquement le jeu de l’analogie

w/ sublime, everything that is compared to it is small > here, Kant throws a bridge, the bridge like the symbol throws itself [by way of reason?], btwn unpresentable and presentation > the whole world can be made small in relation to sublime magnitude

REST.content: whose shoes (whose feet) (the subject of reattachment): the capital subject of this contract [btwn Shapiro & Heidegger], they each have one piece of symbolon, share common interest, coded commitment

C.content: breakable, limping hyphen: not only an emblem, a coat of arms, but the symbol > acc. symballein, brings together pieces of a body divided in contract, pact, alliance [symballistic]
